items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
Rising river levels this morning may lead to flooding.
Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible, property flooding is not expected.
Flooding is possible when river levels are at their highest from 9:04 AM on 29/08/2025.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Shuttle/ Cray, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around low lying land and roads along the river. / low lying land and roads along the River Shuttle particularly in and around Bexley.
Further rainfall is forecast this afternoon but no further flooding is expected.
We are closely monitoring the situation and monitoring rainfall and river levels.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 9:05 AM on 30/08/2025, or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 29/08/2025 from 08:00, as a lot of rain fell on Friday morning (45mm in only 7 hours). Flooding could affect Barnham Road, Lake Lane, and a small number of riverside properties in Marshall Close, Barnham. With the Aldingbourne Rife starting at a low level, only minor flood impacts affecting fields and land, is currently expected in Bersted and Felpham. We will update if more significant impacts become more probable. Rain is forecast to continue until 08:00 29/08/2025, with a small amount of rain and showers possible Friday afternoon and through the weekend. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce in Barnham by 12:00 29/08/2025, and Saturday in Bersted. We are closely monitoring the situation clearing debris screens through Barnham. Our pumps at Felpham are running. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. Including in Barnham. Avoid roads that flood (Barnham Rd and Lake Lane). This message will be updated by 20:00 on the 29/08/2025.

items.description: Scrase Bridge and West Common Streams

floodArea.riverOrSea: Scrase Bridge Stream, West Common Stream

items.message: High river levels on Friday may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 29/08/2025 from 07:00 as intense (but uncertain) rainfall is forecast. Up to 40mm of rain could occur, but there is low confidence in location. If as much rain falls as predicted, then flooding could be possible. Flooding could affect a small number of properties on Bridge Road and West Common Road. Flooding could affect properties near the Witch Inn, along Hickmans Lane and Blackthorns, and odd numbered properties from 29 to 47 on Meadow Drive. River levels are likely to be higher than observed over the last 2 months. River levels should begin to fall by 12:00 29/08/2025. More rain is forecast on Monday (35mm), which could cause flood risk to return. We are clearing debris from weed screens through Lindfield, including the Builders Centre and Witch Inn. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Report blockages at Bridge Road or Hickmans Lane to 0800 80 70 60. This message will be updated by 29/08/2025 15:00.

items.description: River Pol and Langreek Stream at Polperro
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding from the River Pol and Langreek Stream has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. No further flooding is expected on Friday, however further rainfall is forecast on Saturday which may lead to further flooding.

Water levels in the Western Yar at Freshwater have now fallen.  40mm of rain fell in 3 hours up to 06:00 this morning, Friday (29/08/25). Further short showers are expected throughout the day, but river levels are not expected to rise significantly again.  We continue to monitor the forecast and will issue further advice if the situation changes.
